intro: Erianthus ravennae subsp. parviflorus, commonly known as the small-flowered reed, is a grass species native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is characterized by its slender,丛生 growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences with pale green to brown flowers. It thrives in wetland and marshy environments, often found near rivers and lakes. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
